content.description:
The volume of a spherical hot air balloon expands as the air inside the balloon is heated. The radius of the balloon, in feet, is modeled by a twice-differentiable function r of time t, where t is measured in minutes. For 0 < t < 12, the graph of r is concave down. The table above gives selected values of the rate of change, r'(t), of radius of the balloon over the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>12</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CA8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The radius of the balloon is 30 feet when t = 5.

(Note: The volume of a sphere of radius r is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mn>4</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mi>π</mi><msup> <mi>r</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.)
content.question: Use a right Riemann sum with the five subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>12</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>r</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@405B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>12</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>r</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@405B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in terms of the radius of the balloon.

frqParts.text: Use a right Riemann sum with the five subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>12</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>r</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@405B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>12</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>r</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@405B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in terms of the radius of the balloon.

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
